nodes.bodyText: I have not seen an app that uses ellipses in the end of settings descriptions. The main Android settings app does not use them, too. I would prefer to not add them.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -388,6 +392,7 @@
     <string name="pref_mobileUpdate_episode_download">Episode download</string>
     <string name="pref_mobileUpdate_streaming">Streaming</string>
     <string name="user_interface_label">User Interface</string>
+    <string name="user_interface_sum">Appearance, subscription order, lockscreen..</string>

nodes.bodyText: My favorite Android podcast app is BeyondPod and they use ellipses, but I will remove them, they add no real value except to convey there is more...
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -388,6 +392,7 @@

nodes.bodyText: External services? I think the description should not repeat the title here. Users probably don't know what gpodder.net is. Maybe synchronization?

nodes.bodyText: Please don't repeat the heading. A "Storage" setting obviously manages storage. This does not provide additional value to the users and clutters the interface.
